item.title: Autumn Away Day Report & Birthday Bash 2020!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Whittlebury Park – Sunday, 29th September, 2019 The September away day took place under stressful circumstances not helped by a gloomy weather forecast that led to some absentees. The forecast proved to be disappointingly accurate and the predicted rainstorm and high winds arrived as play took place. Winner on the day was Mike Stannard with […]
item.content:encoded:
Whittlebury Park – Sunday, 29th September, 2019

The September away day took place under stressful circumstances not helped by a gloomy weather forecast that led to some absentees. The forecast proved to be disappointingly accurate and the predicted rainstorm and high winds arrived as play took place. Winner on the day was Mike Stannard with 29 points who also took nearest the pin on the 5th hole. Martin Sykes struck the longest drive of the day.

Birthday Bash!!

Looking ahead into 2020, we’re looking forward to the annual “Birthday Bash” that will take place this year at West Berks Golf Club on Sunday, 16th February with a first tee time of midday (meet at 11am). The cost for golf and prize kitty is a very reasonable £20. Please let Peter know if you’re able to attend and please note that there is no requirement for up-front payment on this occasion.

We hope to see as many of you there as possible.

item.title: Autumn Away Day
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Whittlebury Park – Sunday, 29th September 2019 Our final away day of the year will see a return to Whittlebury Park where we have been assured of buggy availability and fine course conditions. First tee time is 10:00am and the cost is £25 including coffee and bacon roll on arrival. The cost to hire a […]
item.content:encoded:
Whittlebury Park – Sunday, 29th September 2019

Our final away day of the year will see a return to Whittlebury Park where we have been assured of buggy availability and fine course conditions.

First tee time is 10:00am and the cost is £25 including coffee and bacon roll on arrival. The cost to hire a buggy is £25.

Whittlebury Park have asked for payment in advance, so if you’re able to join us please transfer funds to the normal Harris Golf trip account asap. Peter will send a text with the account details for those who have misplaced it.

Finally, a small update regarding our May trip next year – a 9 hole “Woodland Walk” has been added to the itinerary for Monday with a tee time of 4:30pm. Perfect for those who would otherwise spend the entire afternoon and evening in the bar – yes Phil, that’s you!!

item.title: Summer Away Day Report – 21st July 2019
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: South Cerney Golf Club The day was once again hosted by Dave Mitchell and saw some fine scoring with Frank Tanner winning with 39 points closely followed by Paul Needle with 37 points. No team event was held, but spot prizes were awarded as follows: Nearest the Pin on the 15th – Dave Mitchell Nearest […]
item.content:encoded:
South Cerney Golf Club

The day was once again hosted by Dave Mitchell and saw some fine scoring with Frank Tanner winning with 39 points closely followed by Paul Needle with 37 points.

No team event was held, but spot prizes were awarded as follows:

Nearest the Pin on the 15th – Dave Mitchell

Nearest the Pin in 2 on the 12th – Paul Needle

Longest drive on the 18th – Martin Sykes.

Congratulations also to Reg Brown who recorded the only birdie 2 of the day.

item.title: Spring Away Day 2019
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Whittlebury Park Golf Club, Sunday 7th April The April away day was held on the Whittlebury and Grand Prix (Red & Blue) nines at Whittlebury Park. The top two teams of Team 1 (Dave S, Sue, Paul N) and Team 3 (Richard, Steve C, Martin) could not be separated and so honours were shared. The […]
item.content:encoded:
Whittlebury Park Golf Club, Sunday 7th April

The April away day was held on the Whittlebury and Grand Prix (Red & Blue) nines at Whittlebury Park.

The top two teams of Team 1 (Dave S, Sue, Paul N) and Team 3 (Richard, Steve C, Martin) could not be separated and so honours were shared. The other team comprised Peter H, John G and Mike S.

Individually, Steve C triumphed with 37 points followed by Dave S (35) and Sue S (32).

Spot prizes were awarded as follows:

Nearest the Pin on the 11th – John G

Nearest the Pin on the 5th – Mike S

Longest Drive (9th) & Nearest the Pin x2 (18th) – Dave S

No birdie 2s were recorded.

item.title: 2019 Birthday Event
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: West Berks Golf Club, Sunday 17th February This year’s birthday event was held on a dry but chilly day. Individually, there were some reasonable scores and birthday boy Nigel Wain triumphed with a score of 38 points. This was followed by three players on 33 points who were separated on ‘count back’ in the following […]
item.content:encoded:
West Berks Golf Club, Sunday 17th February

This year’s birthday event was held on a dry but chilly day. Individually, there were some reasonable scores and birthday boy Nigel Wain triumphed with a score of 38 points. This was followed by three players on 33 points who were separated on ‘count back’ in the following order: Mike Standard, Reg Brown & Peter Harris.

Team wise, Team 3 (Nigel, Mike, Jane and Steve M) took 1st prize with 78 points. Team 2 (Richard, David W, Reg) scored 74 points and Team 1 (Peter, Mike Burton & Martin) scored 69 points.

Spot prizes were awarded as follows:

Nearest the Pin on the 11th – Mike Stannard

Nearest the Pin in 2 on the 12th – David Wain

Longest Drive on the 18th – Richard Edmonds

Ladies longest drive – Jane.

There was one birdie 2 recorded – Peter Harris.

item.title: Autumn Away Day Update
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: The Cotswolds Club, Chipping Norton – Saturday, 22nd September Poor weather meant that the Awayday was reduced to four brave souls who battled the conditions for 9 wet and windy holes. Best scores over the 9 holes were Peter Harris with 16 points, Richard Edmonds with 15 and Paul Needle with 14. Martin Sykes also […]
item.content:encoded:
The Cotswolds Club, Chipping Norton – Saturday, 22nd September

Poor weather meant that the Awayday was reduced to four brave souls who battled the conditions for 9 wet and windy holes.

Best scores over the 9 holes were Peter Harris with 16 points, Richard Edmonds with 15 and Paul Needle with 14. Martin Sykes also attended.

item.title: Late Summer Away Day

item.description: The Cotswolds Club, Chipping Norton – Saturday, 22nd September Please let Peter know if you’re able to join us for the last meeting of 2018. First tee is at 3pm and the cost is £25 including prize kitty.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Summer Away Day Report – 22 July 2018
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Ogbourne Downs Golf Club The July awayday was held in fine sunny weather. Thanks are due to host Christine Mitchell who scored 32 points in the individual competition securing third place. David Mitchell scored 35 points to take second with Mike Stannard the winner on 36 Team wise, David with Frank Tanner and Reg Brown […]
item.content:encoded:
Ogbourne Downs Golf Club

The July awayday was held in fine sunny weather.
Thanks are due to host Christine Mitchell who scored 32 points in the individual competition securing third place. David Mitchell scored 35 points to take second with Mike Stannard the winner on 36
Team wise, David with Frank Tanner and Reg Brown came out on top on count-back with 77 points.
Spot prizes went to Mike Stannard   NTP x 2  (3rd)
David Mitchell    NTP    (17th)
David Scott & Christine Mitchell LD (14th)
2x2s from David Mitchell & Richard Edmonds

item.title: Spring Away Day Report – 8th, April 2018
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: West Berks Golf Club 11 brave souls endured poor weather with both individual and team competitions held. Individually, Nigel Wain (reigning tour champion) took the honours with 32 points including a back nine of 20 . Dave Scott carded 30 to finish runner up with Christine Mitchell third with 29. Team wise, Nigel along with Richard Edmonds,Peter […]
item.content:encoded:
West Berks Golf Club

11 brave souls endured poor weather with both individual and team competitions held.
Individually, Nigel Wain (reigning tour champion) took the honours with 32 points including a back nine of 20 . Dave Scott carded 30 to finish runner up with Christine Mitchell third with 29.
Team wise, Nigel along with Richard Edmonds,Peter Harris and David Mitchell triumphed on count back with 64 pts from Christine, Sue Scott & Frank Tanner.
The other team – Dave, Paul Needle, Reg Brown and John Gent – also managed a score containing the numbers 6 & 4, however they were in a slightly different order.
Two spot prizes went to Paul who secured Longest Drive on the last and NTPin x2 on 3rd.
Sue was the longest lady (drive wise), and Nigel claimed NTP on the 11th. Nigel also secured the 2’s club money on the tricky 17th.
Next away day will be sometime in July tbc – but more importantly the main event looms in May.
It looks like Nigel’s coming into form at just the right time to defend his trophy.
